ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient's features closely match those of KBG syndrome, including intellectual disability, global developmental delay, macrodontia, thick eyebrow, abnormality of the hand, short stature, delayed speech and language development, and hypertelorism, which are all hallmark signs of this condition.

Coffin-Siris syndrome shares several features with the patient's presentation, such as intellectual disability, global developmental delay, short stature, delayed speech and language development, and hypertelorism, though macrodontia and thick eyebrows are less commonly associated.

Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome can present with intellectual disability, global developmental delay, short stature, delayed speech and language development, and hypertelorism, but macrodontia and thick eyebrows are not typical features.

Noonan syndrome may include intellectual disability, global developmental delay, short stature, delayed speech and language development, and hypertelorism, but macrodontia and thick eyebrows are not commonly seen.

Williams syndrome can present with intellectual disability, global developmental delay, short stature, delayed speech and language development, and hypertelorism, but macrodontia and thick eyebrows are not typical features.
